title: France and Germany agree to block Facebook's Libra
text:
France and Germany agree to block Facebook's Libra

Stock Markets 3 hours ago (Sep 13, 2019 17:12)

PARIS (Reuters) - France and Germany have agreed to block Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency, the French finance ministry said on Friday. In a joint statement, the two governments affirmed that "no private entity can claim monetary power, which is inherent to the sovereignty of nations". French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday that Facebook's new cryptocurrency should not be allowed to operate in Europe while concerns persist about sovereignty and persistent financial risks.
